title.value: Агрохимические показатели деградированных торфяных почв по данным крупномасштабного агрохимического обследования
Agrochemical parameters destroyed peat soil in conditions intensification of agricultural use

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Tsaruk, I.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Soil Science and Agrochemistry

abstract.value: In course of the research there was realized the systematization and analysis of indicators of agrochemical properties of degraded peat soils of the Brest and Gomel areas (the Republic of Belarus) after considering the results of 11 round (2005-2008) of large-scale agrochemical inspection of agricultural lands. As a result of realized research it was revealed that the quantity (amount) of destroyed peat in comparison with the previous period in the Brest area increased up to 79.4 thousand ha (on 16.4 thousand ha), in Gomel area - up to 63.2 thousand ha (on 5.2 thousand ha). In total amount of the degraded peat soils of Brest area on a share of soils with the contents of organic substance less than 20% was necessary 65%, and in the Gomel area – 84.5%. Destroyed peat lands on acidic levels were distributed as follows: with pH 5.01-6.0 - 62-66% from the general area, with pH less than 5.01 - 19-20%, with pH more than 6.01 - 15-19%.
